newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: CRICKET-WEST INDIES SEND PAKISTAN INTO BAT.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-WEST INDIES SEND PAKISTAN INTO BAT.

text.p: West Indies captain Courtney Walsh won the toss and sent Pakistan into bat in a World Series limited overs match at Adelaide Oval on Tuesday.
Australia lead the triangular competition with four points from three games, two points clear of Pakistan.
Pakistan named an unchanged side after beating Australia by 12 runs in the tourists' opening match on Sunday.
West Indies called up fast bowler Nixon McLean as replacement for fellow paceman Ian Bishop, who was ruled out with an injured toe.
West Indies have lost their first two matches and prop up the table without a point.

Pakistan - Aamir Sohail, Zahoor Elahi, Ijaz Ahmed, Mohammad Wasim, Inzamam-ul-Haq, Moin Khan, Shahid Afridi, Saqlain Mushtaq, Wasim Akram (captain), Waqar Younis, Mushtaq Ahmed, Shahid Nazir (12th man)

West Indies - Robert Samuels, Sherwin Campbell, Brian Lara, Carl Hooper, Shivnarine Chanderpaul, Jimmy Adams, Junior Murray, Kenneth Benjamin, Nixon McLean, Curtly Ambrose, Courtney Walsh (captain), Adrian Griffith (12th man)
